solution_line_template: Four {capacity_per_table_type1}-seater tables can accommodate {num_tables_type1} x {capacity_per_table_type1} = <<{num_tables_type1}*{capacity_per_table_type1}={capacity_type1}>>{capacity_type1} people.

Sixteen {capacity_per_table_type2}-seater tables can accommodate {num_tables_type2} x {capacity_per_table_type2} = <<{num_tables_type2}*{capacity_per_table_type2}={capacity_type2}>>{capacity_type2} people.

Eight {capacity_per_table_type3}-seater table can accommodate {num_tables_type3} x {capacity_per_table_type3} = <<{num_tables_type3}*{capacity_per_table_type3}={capacity_type3}>>{capacity_type3} people.

Therefore, all the tables in the party venue can accommodate {capacity_type1} + {capacity_type2} + {capacity_type3} =<<{capacity_type1}+{capacity_type2}+{capacity_type3}={total_capacity}>>{total_capacity} people.
